summary: The American Innovation Act of 2025 primarily focuses on tax changes to promote new business innovation. It simplifies and expands deductions for start-up and organizational expenditures, including inflation adjustments. The bill also introduces provisions to preserve start-up net operating losses and tax credits after ownership changes, offering exceptions for start-up losses and excess credits. The amendments generally apply to expenditures and taxable years beginning after specific dates in 2025 and 2026.
